entry.title: DELINS IDoc: How can system accept different time daily schedule line
entry.content:
We receive inbound DELINS IDoc and for one location, it wants to accept time specific daily schedule lines for SDSA.  Currently, the logic in IDOC_INPUT_DELINS overwrites the existing daily schedule line if the incoming IDoc has the same date even if the time and quantity is different.  In manual VA32 transaction, it allows multiple daily schedule line for the same date and different time.  But not for the inbound IDoc. 

For example, if the SDSA has existing daily schedule line 19.09.2025 time 04:00 with quantity 300 ST, and then IDoc segment field E1EDP16-EDATUV 19.09.2025, E1EDP16-EZEIT 16:00 with quantity E1EDP16-WMENG 150 ST.  The SDSA schedule line will be updated to 19.09.2025 16:00 150 ST.  Our expectation is the SDSA should have 2 daily lines for the date 19.09.2025.

I'm not sure if this is a bug but in case, is there a note on this?  Or can this be solved by customizing or a user-exit/enhancement needs to be implemented in function module IDOC_INPUT_DELINS?

entry.title: [SAP MM/SD] Impedimento de Venda de Material ROH - Produto de Dupla Função
entry.content:
Prezados,

Configuração ROH em Venda (SD): Por padrão, no Mestre de Materiais, o tipo ROH (Matéria-Prima) qual será o comportamento exato do sistema ao tentar inseri-lo em um Pedido de Venda (VA01)? O sistema emitirá um erro de dado mestre (travando a inclusão do item) ou um bloqueio de tipo de item/processo?"
Pois temos um item que estamos pensando em classificar como ROH porém utilizamos ele comprado pra consumo no produto quanto  para vende-lo avulso.

 

EX - Uma roda de carro, tanto ela é matéria prima para a fabricação do veículo quanto posso vende-la avulsa.

entry.title: Issue with sales order creation
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have some code in the user exit SAVE_DOCUMENT_PREPARE which is trigerred during sales order creation. In that code, i need to access all the schedule lines for an item so I am using the table XVBEP[] for that. For creating sales order i am using a material for which the confirmed stock is of a future date which means if i create a sales order today with that material, the i have two schedule line that item. the first one being of today's delivery date with 0 confirmed quantity and the other one with future delivery date with the required confirmed quantity.


when i put a break-point in my code piece in the user exit and create a sales order using Tcode va01, then when the break point hits in the debugger, i have two records in the XVBEP[] table. But when I create a sales order from an external system which calls the BAPI BAPI_SALESORDER_CREATEFROMDAT2 and put a break-point at the same spot, then I only got 1 record in the XVBRP[] table in debugger. I don't get the second schedule line with the confirmed quantity. But this sales order is saved by the external system using the BAPI, then it shows two schedule lines in va03. Also, there are no custom enhancements that deleted schedules lines.

Can anyone please help what could be the issue behind getting only one schedule line when sales order is created via external system using bapi?
@Chris1973 @Chuma @junwu @Sandra_Rossi @DonWilliams @Lakshmipathi

entry.title: API for Product Availability
entry.content:
Hi,

we are running S/4Hana 2022 FPS01 and I was searching the Product Availability Service on api.sap.com. The services on api.sap.com lead me to this help page:  https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/15f9e51998a945cc82545cb6b4dbe5c2/ba15d698dd474a57ad340f9acff13b99.html?version=2022.001

Basically there ate two APIs available on our release:

- Basic Product Availability Service -> The product availability information is calculated according to the default Available-to-Promise (ATP) logic and is influenced by the configuration applied in your system.

- Product Availability Info Service: no reference to which ATP version is used within the service implementation...

Does/Should any of these APIs use basic ATP in the background, since we still do not use aATP... Once I try them, I always get response that we are not using aATP... I found even this Blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/two-apis-to-retrieve-availability-information/ba-p/13576755

where it might looks like there is always aATP in the background...

If this is the case, is there any other API which still utilize ATP?

BR,

Milan

entry.title: Sales employee in Inquiry and Quotation
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Is there any options to take report of Sales quotation and Sales Inquiry with Sales employee. In Manage Sales Inquiry and Manage Sales Quotation there is no standard option to add the Sales employee field to filters and Settings in Public cloud. My client needs to track report of how many Quotation and details has been given by Sales employee's. Can you please guide me is there any solution for this or Why SAP has not given the Standard option to filter the Sales employee for Quotation and Inquiry.

Best regards,

Dinesh U

entry.content:

We have created Custom field in all Sales documents, For Example, If we enter any values in the Sales inquiry Custom field, the value in that field should be carried over to Sales quotation Custom field when creating Sales quotation with reference to Sales inquiry, to achieve this what are the Configuration steps should be done from Functional side ?

entry.title: BAPI_OUTB_DELIVERY_CREATE_STO with extension_in
entry.content:
i used the BAPI BAPI_OUTB_DELIVERY_CREATE_STO with extension_in  for LIKP Header update with custom fields ZZ.

as per the SAP documentation, i need to move the fields via badi BADI_DLV_CREATE_STO_EXTIN~ADDITIONAL_INPUT

Inside the badi, i got the custom fields, but iam not able to assign those custom fields to corresponding LIKP delivery header custom fields. The reason is likp structure is not available inside this BADI BADI_DLV_CREATE_STO_EXTIN~ADDITIONAL_INPUT.

How to achieve this, transfer custom fields via  extension_in ?

entry.title: Batch-specific UoM Proportion/product unit of measure GON invalid for item 000010 Message No. VL382
entry.content:
I've a scenario where I have a finished product managed by a Batch-specific UoM with type: Product Unit, and I am facing this error message when I try to make a delivery with the Alternative UoM (Product Unit) Reference to a Sales order with the Base UoM
"The sales Unit (Also the Base UoM) in the sales order is "KG" and the Alternative/required UoM in the Outbound delivery is "GON" 

"GON" UoM is a custom UoM created equivalent to the UoM: "BAG"

Note: this scenario has been tested in MM by creating a PO with UoM: "KG" and MIGO GR by UoM: "GON" and it's working properly

The error message:

Proportion/product unit of measure GON invalid for item 000010

Message No. VL382

entry.title: I want to see the relevant Billing documents for a sales order in Sales Volume Flexible analysis app
entry.content:
When I tried to query the sales volume Flexible Analysis app  based on a sales document number I am expecting all the relevant billing documents (Credit memo or debit memo) to be shown in the report, so that I can analyze the costs and profit margins and sale volume. But, report is showing sales order data, Delivery and it's billing document data. 

Could you please help me how can I achieve my requirement.
App Name: Sales Volume - Flexible Analysis
App ID: F1250

entry.title: Resourse Related Billing and WBS elements
entry.content:
Hello

We have the below scenario. 

Our heartquart receives an invocie for IT costs. It is posted using a generic cost center. Then we allocate the costs to WBS elements which each of them represents our subsidiaries. 
Then we want to create a sales order and assing the respective WBS element in order to use the resource related billing functionality.
We will use DP90 or DP91 to create the demo memo and then VF01 for issuing the invoice.
The problem is in customizing. 
We don't know how to link the WBS elements and the posted values to SD area and proceed with the next steps.
Could you please guide us regarding the customizing?

Thank you

entry.title: Guidance: creating 4 separate pricing procedures for OR/RE/CR/DR (learning)
entry.content:
My mentor asked me to build four separate pricing procedures for OR (standard sale), RE (return), CR (credit memo request), DR (debit memo request). Could you please advise:

  1. How to set up these four procedures end-to-end in a simple, standard way?

  2. Which parts should be shared across all, and which should be separate per procedure?

  3. How to set Document Pricing Procedure (DPP) per sales order type and map OVKK so each order uses the correct procedure?

  4. For RE (returns): which conditions do you usually keep vs. drop, and how to handle signs and tax correctly?

  5. For CR/DR: what’s the minimal set of conditions that still posts correctly to FI?

  6. In Copy Control with references, which Pricing Type  do you recommend for RE/CR/DR, and when?

Thanks! This is a learning sandbox, so any concise tips or references are much appreciated.

entry.title: Automatic creation of PR for components when production order is created
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I’m working on a Make-to-Order (MTO) process in SAP S/4HANA where a production order is created automatically at the moment of sales order creation.

Here’s the current setup and behavior:

  • The finished good (FG) is set to Individual/Collective indicator = 1 (Individual requirements).

  • A production order is created automatically when the sales order is saved.

  • The BOM components have item category “L” (stock item) and procurement type “F” (external procurement).

  • At production order creation, the system generates reservations for these components.

  • When I run MRP, the system correctly creates purchase requisitions for those reservations, and each PR is account-assigned to the sales order (special stock “E”).

Is there a way through standard configuration to trigger automatic PR creation for stock components linked to a sales order (special stock “E”) at the time of production order creation, without running MRP?

#PP  #MRP  #MakeToOrder  #PurchaseRequisition

entry.title: Invoice Print Type - IDOC vs Form (Fragmented Forms)
entry.content:
Hello Gurus,

I'm looking for some inspiration and war stories from you talented people.
Are we the only ones struggeling with the Print Type settings in the pricing procedure when controlling output in the our Adobe Forms as well as INVOIC IDOC?

Background: In our pricing procedure we're using Print Type to control both line item pricing display on the form as well as determine value in IDOC Segment E1EDP26 (INVOIC02). Business wants these two outpu to differ in certain countries - E.g. Form to show a set of pricing, while IDOC typically containing more.

We have tried: Changing the content of the form directly, supressing values from the Print Type setting, leaving a mismatch between Print Type and actual print. However, using the same form across multiple countries, following method significantly increases complexity.

Have any of you successfully managed to separate the Print Type setting for the form content from IDOC content? Any advice on how to implement the split?

Appreciate you time,
Best regards,
Aske

SAP S/4HANA SD (Sales and Distribution)

entry.title: Update new pricing after changing pricing condition record
entry.content:
Hello all,

Currently I am facing an issue that, I do an enhancement in USEREXIT_XKOMV_BEWERTEN_END to insert a new pricing condition into XKOMV table.
The copy works fine, however, from user expectation, some of the value should be updated. But this only happens if we access to VA02 manually, and click Update Pricing => G for specific item.
The update won't happen automatically in the background after copying.
Is there any way that I can do the update pricing = G in the USEREXIT_XKOMV_BEWERTEN_END?

Thank you for your time!
